column1: #Text=Saransk is the capital city of the Republic of Mordovia , its financial and economic center .
#Text=It is located on the river Insar , about southeast of Moscow .
#Text=Saransk was founded as a fortress in 1641 .
#Text=It was part of a chain of fortifications , created by Grand Duchy of Moscow and later the Tsardom of Russia , to protect it from the raids of the Crimean Tatars .
#Text=The fortress was far away from the main trade routes , so it could not become a major economic center and until the 1930s it was largely comprised of wooden one-story houses .
#Text=It was appointed as the capital of the Mordovia in 1934 which imposed grand urban redevelopment ; the old center was almost entirely demolished and replaced by Stalin-era architecture .
#Text=The center was then again modernised between 2000 and 2010 ; some houses were restored using modern materials and some were demolished and replaced by modern harmonious buildings .
#Text=Saransk will host World Cup football matches and at least the city center will not lose face in front of guests .
#Text=There are no architectural ensembles in the center of Saransk .
#Text=Overall , the old architecture is quite sparse and is not a first-class one .
#Text=In this regard the city does n't differ a lot from other cities in central Russia .
#Text=Also you wo n’t hear any national languages other than Russian spoken here unless you make some special efforts .

#Text=There are two main tourist sites which make Saransk worth visiting : a museum of fine arts with a large collection of sculptures created by Stephen Erzi and 18th century Makarov Monastery - one of the most spectacular ensembles of the Middle Volga region .
#Text=Additionally , there is a good museum of Mordovian national culture and some modern architecture partly stylised as a national one .
#Text=There are regular train services from Moscow , Nizhny Novgorod and Kazan taking you to Saransk .
#Text=The trains between Moscow and Saransk take around 10 hours 40 mins to cover the route .
#Text=Saransk has a small airport too and a flight from the Russian capital takes just about an hour .
#Text=Museum of Mordovia Folk Culture , Sovetskaya St , 19 , ☏ +7834 224-67-94 .
#Text=Learn about the histories of the two Mordvin ethnocultural groups , the Erzya and Moksha .
#Text=Cathedral of St. Theodore Ushakov ( Собор Святого Феодора Ушакова ) .
#Text=This new stadium was a surprise choice to host matches in the 2018 FIFA World Cup .
#Text=The home team are FC Mordovia Saransk who play in the Russian Football National League , the second tier of Russian football , having won promotion in 2018 .
#Text=Even with that , the club ( who previously played at the Start Stadium ) will struggle to fill their new home 's 28,000 capacity , and it 's expected that other events will be staged here .
#Text=The Arena is just 1 km east of city centre .
#Text=Gift shop selling Erzhya arts and craft , traditional clothing and other souvenirs .
#Text=Irish pub with over 50 types of beer .
#Text=The staff at reception and the restaurant do n't speak English very well but there are menus in English .
#Text=Head to the second largest city in the republic and industrial center Ruzayevka
